poem:
**Odds Against Us**

Coins splash, tumble, and spin—
the roulette of our morals.
£100 million chips
we stake on borrowed tomorrows.
A ledger with no name,
a delay tightrope-walks
over the loss of lives,
while hearts are banked and razed,
and promises lay frayed,
a dice roll away
from forgotten.
